intro: Craspedodictyum, commonly known as the spiny cactus, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cactaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and South Africa. The plants are characterized by their cylindrical or ribbed stems, which are often covered in spines for protection. They produce yellow or white flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Craspedodictyum species are typically drought-tolerant and adapted to thrive in harsh, dry environments.
